problem: Find the coefficient of $x$ when $3(x - 4) + 4(7 - 2x^2 + 5x) - 8(2x - 1)$ is simplified.
chatgpt_solution:
We distribute and get \begin{align*}
3(x - 4) + 4(7 - 2x^2 + 5x) - 8(2x - 1) &= 3x - 12 + 28 - 8x^2 + 20x - 16x + 8 \\
&= \boxed{-8x^2 + 7x + 24}.
\end{align*}The coefficient of $x$ is $\boxed{7}$.
